abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Guangdong
            Provincial Highway Project is rated as satisfactory. The
            objective of reducing congestion in the corridors has been
            met with traffic on the highways taking from 27 to 67
            percent of the total corridor traffic in 1999. Furthermore,
            the economic benefits are considered sustainable, without
            any predictable elements of risk, as traffic has been
            growing rapidly. The lessons drawn from this project
            include: 1) Securitization of Bank financed assets is the
            most innovative aspect of the project. Securitization
            operations contributed significantly to the financing of the
            Foshan-Kaiping Expressway (FKE) without any liability to
            sovereign or sub-sovereign agencies for the repayment, since
            the funds raised through these transactions were in effect
            leveraged by the future traffic stream on FKE. Efforts to
            securitize existing revenue-producing assets with the
            involvement of credible international institutions will
            continue to be an important capital-raising device for the
            country. 2) Substantial cost overruns were encountered in
            the construction of FKE and Longgang-Tanxi Expressway. A
            more in-depth project preparation will be cost-effective in
            securing the technical design and selecting suitable
            construction methods. 3) The soil settlement problem needs
            further remedial works. 4) More involvement in construction
            and rehabilitation of lower class roads would directly help
            remote communities to alleviate poverty.

5077595.trustfund: TF020350-DANISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF021251-PHRD-JAPANESE CTF (USD ACCOUNT),TF028065-CANADIAN CONSLT. COOP. PROGRAM
5077595.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Trade and integration

abstracts.cdata!:
The project has the following
            objectives:  (a) to relieve congestion in two major traffic
            corridors; (b) to improve other national and provincial
            roads carrying substantial volumes of traffic; (c) to
            promote the transfer of highway technology through training
            and the provision of equipment; (d) to further develop
            institutional capability in highway design, planning and
            prioritization; and (e) to implement reforms of highway
            financing.  The project includes:  (a) construction on new
            alignments of the four-lane divided, access controlled,
            Foshan-Kaiping Highway and Longgang-Tanxi Highway; (b) a
            Road Improvement Program for upgrading and rehabilitating
            about 1,260 km of provincial and national roads; (c)
            consultant services for construction supervision of the
            highways; (d) technical assistance to support analysis of
            highway finances in Guangdong Province and to formulate an
            action program for implementing reforms; (e) a road safety
            pilot project; (f) further development of the Road Data Bank
            and Pavement Management System; (g) purchase of equipment
            for road laboratories, environmental protection, road
            research, the road data bank, the pavement management
            system, road maintenance and highway operations; and (h)
            staff training.
